page.title: 09THE VILLAGE - Employment
page.content:
only limited local employment opportunities e.g. in the local shops, hotels and inns, retirement home, the golf club and the nearby farming estates. Therefore in recent years the village has become very much a "dormer community" despite been a conservation area. This has meant that new housing and other development is strictly controlled, and in recent times very little new building has taken place except for "The Gardens".
Halfway down the village street, on the north side,is the venerable Mercat Cross, on its plinth of steps. Aberlady was a burgh of barony, and this cross symbolised the fact. It has lost its cross-finial, presumably at the Reformation.
